input:

17:47 Caption: Sami Khedira (Juventus) does his best to latch onto a cross into the box, but he can't get to the ball.
17:52 Event: Clearance by Napoli
17:58 Event: Offside by Napoli

18:22 Caption: The linesman raises his flag as one of the players from Napoli was in an offside position.
19:10 Event: Shots off target by Juventus

19:39 Caption: Stephan Lichtsteiner (Juventus) finds space on the edge of the box, but his wild shot goes high over the bar.

20:15 Event: Yellow card by Juventus
20:29 Caption: A yellow card for a tackle by Giorgio Chiellini (Juventus). Gianluca Rocchi doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
20:39 Event: Indirect free-kick by Napoli
20:59 Event: Foul by Juventus
21:02 Event: Yellow card by Juventus

23:35 Caption: Great chance! Gonzalo Higuain (Juventus) collects a great pass inside the box, but the goalkeeper does well to stop his effort. The ball goes behind for a corner. Juventus will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
24:01 Event: Corner by Juventus
24:15 Caption: Miralem Pjanic (Juventus) launches a powerful cross from the corner into the box, but the ball is intercepted by the defender.

25:30 Caption: Kalidou Koulibaly (Napoli) gets on the ball and beats an opponent, but his run is stopped by the referee Gianluca Rocchi who sees an offensive foul.

29:39 Event: Foul by Napoli
29:45 Event: Yellow card by Napoli
29:57 Caption: The foul by Lorenzo Insigne (Napoli) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Gianluca Rocchi. That's a free kick to Juventus.
30:37 Event: Direct free-kick by Juventus
30:52 Caption: Miralem Pjanic (Juventus) is going to send the ball in from the free kick.
30:59 Caption: Miralem Pjanic (Juventus) puts a cross into the box from the free kick, but the defender gets there first.
32:45 Event: Foul by Juventus
32:52 Caption: Gianluca Rocchi blows his whistle for a foul after Mario Mandzukic (Juventus) hacks down one of his opponents.
33:04 Event: Indirect free-kick by Napoli
33:56 Caption: Lorenzo Insigne (Napoli) sends a cross into the box, but Gianluigi Buffon comes off his line to gather the ball.
34:58 Caption: The game is interrupted now, Allan (Napoli) picks up a knock and the physio has to come on.
36:45 Caption: Allan (Napoli) seems to be alright and is okay to carry on.
37:25 Event: Ball out of play
38:33 Event: Substitution by Juventus
39:08 Caption: Massimiliano Allegri is forced to make a change. Giorgio Chiellini is unable to continue due to injury, Juan Cuadrado (Juventus) comes on.

40:54 Event: Indirect free-kick by Napoli

41:52 Caption: Juventus seem to be finding their feet as they enjoy some possession. They are waiting for the right moment to create new attacking opportunities.
42:47 Event: Foul by Juventus
42:56 Caption: Miralem Pjanic (Juventus) was trying to get to the ball but clattered into the legs of the opponent as well. Gianluca Rocchi blows his whistle for an infringement. Napoli are awarded a free kick. Let's see what they create from this.
44:12 Event: Shots off target by Napoli
44:12 Event: Direct free-kick by Napoli
44:13 Event: Ball out of play
44:21 Caption: Faouzi Ghoulam (Napoli) fires in an effort from the free kick from some 25 metres. His strike is very inaccurate and ends in row Z.
44:31 Event: Clearance by Juventus
44:37 Event: Ball out of play
44:40 Event: Throw-in by Juventus
44:56 Event: Ball out of play
46:58 Caption: The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
46:59 Caption: The opening 45 minutes weren't very eventful and the game could be described as an average one. There wasn't any evident superiority by either side during the first half. Both sides are using combination football to try and gain the upper hand.

Second Half:
00:00 Event: Kick-off by Napoli
00:00 Caption: There will be a minimum of 2 min. of added time.
00:01 Caption: The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
00:09 Event: Ball out of play
00:17 Event: Throw-in by Juventus
01:04 Event: Ball out of play
01:16 Caption: Lorenzo Insigne (Napoli) is picked out by his teammate with a brilliant short pass, but it takes him too long to control the ball inside the box and this allows one of the defending players to rob him.
01:19 Event: Throw-in by Napoli
02:25 Event: Shots off target by Juventus

03:32 Event: Ball out of play

04:01 Event: Corner by Juventus

04:40 Caption: GOAL! A terrible mistake leads to a goal. The defender ends up losing possession, allowing Leonardo Bonucci (Juventus) to pick up the ball before slotting it into the back of the net to make it 1:0.
05:01 Event: Kick-off by Napoli
05:32 Event: Shots on target by Juventus
05:32 Caption: Dries Mertens (Napoli) received a pass inside the box and sent a dangerous shot in on goal, but keep the champagne on ice as one of the defenders stepped in and blocked the effort. It's hard to say whether the keeper would have stopped it. Napoli have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.

09:19 Event: Kick-off by Juventus
10:50 Caption: Sami Khedira (Juventus) sends a teasing cross into the area, but Pepe Reina intercepts the ball.
11:32 Event: Shots on target by Juventus

40:47 Event: Direct free-kick by Napoli

41:11 Caption: Omar El Kaddouri (Napoli) connects with the free kick and produces a header goalwards which is well blocked. The goalkeeper doesn't have to worry about that one. Corner kick. Napoli will have an opportunity.
41:14 Event: Corner by Napoli
41:19 Event: Shots off target by Napoli

43:50 Caption: unleashes a shot from 23 metres out but is unable to find the target and it goes high over the crossbar.
44:06 Event: Clearance by Juventus
44:14 Event: Foul by Napoli

46:30 Caption: Flag up against Jose Callejon (Napoli). He had space to move into behind the defence, but he went too soon.
47:48 Caption: Elseid Hysaj (Napoli) makes a reckless foul in order to win the ball from his opponent. Gianluca Rocchi has a clear sight of it and blows his whistle. Juventus win a free kick.
48:40 Caption: The free kick is taken short by Juventus.
50:11 Caption: Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
50:59 Caption: We were witnesses to a rather ordinary game without many stirring moments. There is definitely room for improvement in future games. The game was quite balanced and neither team had any obvious advantage. Both sides tried to prevail using combination football.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
In a captivating encounter at the Allianz Stadium, Juventus narrowly edged out Napoli with a 2-1 victory in what was a pulsating Serie A clash. 

The match kicked off with Juventus seizing early control. From the onset, Juventus attempted to set a dominant pace but were met with staunch resistance from Napoli's defense. The first minute saw a flurry of activity with Juventus pushing forward, but it was clear that both teams were keen on capitalizing on any early errors. The match witnessed early fouls and offsides from both sides, reflecting the high stakes and tension prevalent through the game.

Napoli, led by the subtle creativity of Lorenzo Insigne and the ever-menacing presence of Jose Callejon, tried to break Juventus' defensive line with intricate passes and clever runs. Insigne, in particular, exhibited drive and flair, but Juventus’ defensive bastion, marshalled by Gianluigi Buffon, was up to the task. Callejon found himself in promising positions early on but either lacked the final touch or was skillfully denied by Juventus defenders. His efforts were commendable despite Juventus thwarting his initial attempts.

It wasn’t long before Napoli's Pere Reina was called into action. Juventus’ Mario Mandzukic came perilously close to breaking the deadlock with his swift movements and deft touches, but Reina was vigilant, coming off his line to intercept dangerous passes. Equally competent in front of the goal was Buffon, who deftly smothered a swinging cross from Insigne.

The half saw its fair share of cautions, with Juventus' Giorgio Chiellini and Alex Sandro receiving yellow cards for robust tackles. Unfortunately, Chiellini’s involvement was cut short due to an injury that saw Juan Cuadrado replacing him. This substitution fortified Juventus’ wide play, enhancing their attacking options.

Juventus, despite the setbacks, managed several promising attacks, punctuated by Sami Khedira's probing crosses. Although lacking precision at times, Khedira’s deliveries into the box remained a consistent threat. Their persistent endeavor bore attempts from the likes of Stephan Lichtsteiner, Mandzukic, and Gonzalo Higuain, testing Reina's mettle.

Napoli too carved out key moments, with Insigne once again swinging in dangerous crosses. Allan produced a strong strike directed low and central, only to be met by Buffon's assured save. The aggressive dynamics led to physicality as Juve’s Hernanes also found a place in Gianluca Rocchi’s book.

The first half concluded at 0-0, with brief lulls in play giving way to intermittent bursts of energy and enterprise from both sides. The half-time whistle from Rocchi brought a close to an average but tightly contested first 45 minutes.

The second half began with Napoli kicking off and instigating early pressure. Insigne's brilliance continued as he was picked out with a precise pass, managing a shot, albeit soon disrupted by Juventus' organized structure. In response, Juventus upped the ante, and within moments of the second half, they were rewarded. 

Leonardo Bonucci capitalized on a defensive lapse, slotting the ball into the net to give Juventus a 1-0 lead following a well-crafted corner. The goal came as a result of coordinated pressing and a stark reminder to Napoli of the perils in giving Juventus an inch of opportunity. Napoli found themselves in a familiar chase.

Napoli’s response was invigorating. Almost immediately, they earned a corner and pressed high up the field. The coordinated effort paid dividends when Jose Callejon netted an equalizer. Released by a superb lofted pass from Insigne, Callejon drilled a low shot into the middle of the goal to level the score. The equalizer reinforced Napoli’s resilience and offensive prowess.

Juventus, undeterred, returned the offensive play. Khedira and Higuain continued to be driving forces, creating frenzied action near Napoli's goal. Mandzukic and Lichtsteiner, instrumental in stretching Napoli's defense, kept the visitors’ defense on their toes. Pep Reina found himself under constant scrutiny as Juventus sought to regain their lead.

The match transitioned into a tactical battle, with both managers making critical substitutions. Napoli’s Insigne was replaced by Emanuele Giaccherini, bringing fresh legs into the fray, while Juventus responded by introducing Claudio Marchisio for Miralem Pjanic. The changes symbolized both teams’ intent on altering the game's course in their favor.

The tension peaked as Hernanes attempted a shot from the edge of the box for Juventus, but it sailed over the bar, signaling his final effort before being substituted for Stefano Sturaro. Napoli too continued their substitutions, infusing energy through Omar El Kaddouri and Maurizio Sarri strategizing the final efforts.

With time edging closer to a draw, Juventus produced a moment of brilliance. Higuain, ever the predator in the box, latched onto a loose ball and deftly steered it into the bottom right corner. It was a precise and clinical finish, reflective of his predatory instincts and Juventus' relentless pursuit of victory. This goal secured a 2-1 lead for Juventus.

In the dying minutes, Napoli, desperate for an equalizer, saw efforts go astray as Dries Mertens, Giaccherini, and others attempted to breach Buffon's defenses. Mertens’ wide shot from the edge of the penalty box and subsequent high attempt highlighted Naples' pressing urgency. Yet, Buffon and the Juventus defense remained resolute, managing to repel the late surges from Napoli.

As the referee Gianluca Rocchi blew the final whistle, Juventus emerged victorious in a match that delivered on the excitement quotient, despite initially being average in its unfolding. The encounter showcased combative spirit, tactical switches, and individual brilliance, particularly from Bonucci and Higuain for Juventus, and Callejon and Insigne for Napoli.

The win underlines Juventus's resilience and their strategic masterminding under Massimiliano Allegri. Napoli, albeit defeated, displayed commendable fortitude and attacking flair, hinting at potential improvements for future fixtures. It was a keenly contested battle, characterized by momentous goalkeeping exploits, tactical adjustments, and the sheer will of Juventus to edge out a determined Napoli side. 

The match, in essence, was an encapsulation of Serie A’s finest, replete with drama, tactical nuances, and moments of individual brilliance, leaving fans thrilled yet yearning for more.
